page.title: 03PENN WOODS IN HOLMER GREEN
page.content: Penn Woods has good footpaths and the trees are marked with white arrows and numbers to help find the way.Apart from trees and bushes the main plants are ferns,rhododendrons,foxgloves,moss and heathers.Leaves cover the ground where nothing is growing.There are many dells filled with dead leaves,which are fun to play in.Birds seen include greater spotted and lesser spotted woodpecker, chiff-chaff,kestrel and chaffinch.There are squirrels and muntjac deer,but few people see the deer.A monument is marked on the map,but this has been damaged.There was also a fountain for the use of wildlife.The monument and the fountain were put in Penn Woods by the Ernest Cook Trust which used to own the woodland.It is now owned by an agent in Gloucestershire.
